metadata.title: CVE-2019-5785 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Incorrect convexity calculations in Skia in Google Chrome prior to72.0.3626.81 allowed a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memorywrite via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5785` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 65.0.1+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 65.0.1+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 65.0.1+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '65.0.1+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
